alert.note: Alert for Bullock; Pike (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 28 at 2:20PM CDT until August 28 at 2:45PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Barbour, Bullock and Pike. * WHEN...Until 530 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 220 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Troy, Brundidge, Clio, Midway, Banks, Boot Hill, Linwood, Pickett, Beans Crossroads, Antioch, Aberfoil, Doster, Josie, Tanyard, Monticello, Sandfield, Perote, Brundidge Municipal Airport, Mount Andrew and Hamilton Crossroads.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
